skill.name: cirq
skill.description: Quantum computing framework for building, simulating, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Use this skill when working with quantum algorithms, quantum circuit design, quantum simulation (noiseless or noisy), running on quantum hardware (Google, IonQ, AQT, Pasqal), circuit optimization and compilation, noise modeling and characterization, or quantum experiments and benchmarking (VQE, QAOA, QPE, randomized benchmarking).
skill.summary: Quantum computing framework for building, simulating, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Us...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation only and does not execute code. It includes examples that configure external quantum hardware endpoints, which implies network usage if users run those snippets.

content.value_statement: Quantum circuit design is complex and easy to misconfigure. This skill provides clear guidance for building, simulating, and running Cirq workflows.
actual_capabilities: Explain circuit construction with qubits, gates, and measurements
Provide state vector and density matrix simulation workflows
Show parameter sweeps and experiment data collection patterns
Describe noise models, characterization, and mitigation methods
Outline hardware provider setup and job submission steps
Explain circuit optimization and compilation techniques
limitations: Requires Cirq and optional provider packages to be installed
Hardware execution needs valid credentials and provider access
Large simulations can be slow and memory intensive
This skill provides guidance and does not run code

use_cases.title: Learn core Cirq patterns
use_cases.description: Build simple circuits, run simulations, and interpret measurement results with guided steps.

use_cases.title: Prototype noisy experiments
use_cases.description: Add noise models, run comparisons across noise levels, and assess mitigation strategies.

use_cases.title: Prepare hardware runs
use_cases.description: Validate circuits, optimize for gatesets, and submit jobs to supported providers.

prompt_templates.title: First circuit
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a two qubit Bell state circuit in Cirq and explain the expected measurement histogram.

prompt_templates.title: Parameter sweep
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a parameterized single qubit circuit with a sweep over theta and explain how to interpret the results.

prompt_templates.title: Noise comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a plan to compare circuit performance across three depolarizing noise levels using Cirq.

prompt_templates.title: Hardware compilation
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline steps to optimize a circuit for a hardware gateset and validate it before submission.

output_examples.input: Explain how to run a noisy simulation and interpret results
output: Define a noise model and apply it to the circuit
Run a density matrix simulation with repetitions
Compare histograms across noise levels to see degradation
Report which states remain dominant and why

best_practices: Test on simulators before hardware runs
Use parameter sweeps for efficient exploration
Validate circuits against device constraints early
anti_patterns: Submitting hardware jobs without circuit validation
Running large density matrix simulations without memory checks
Using unrealistic noise models for analysis

faq.question: Is this compatible with my environment?
faq.answer: It works with Python and Cirq installed. Hardware providers need their specific Cirq extensions.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Simulation scales exponentially with qubits and noise models can increase runtime.

faq.question: How do I integrate with hardware providers?
faq.answer: Install the provider package, configure credentials, and use the provider service APIs in the guide.

faq.question: Does it access my data or keys?
faq.answer: No. It only documents how to set credentials if you choose to use hardware providers.

faq.question: What if simulations are slow or fail?
faq.answer: Reduce qubit count, simplify noise models, or switch to a faster simulator type.

faq.question: How does it compare to other quantum tools?
faq.answer: Cirq focuses on circuit design, simulation, and hardware integration for its ecosystem.
